page.title: 08Social Concerns (2)
page.content: Stubble burning is a particularly emotive issue, as it causes pollution and destroys natural habitats. Most farmers find it an effective and cheap way of removing straw waste, and an increasing number are responsive to public urgency for an effective alternative. Use of pesticides and nitrates is common, and may lead to problems in the future (see Ecology and Farming) Occasional "fen blows" remove the top of lighter soils when the land is dry, necessitating replanting. Fine black dust permeates all houses in the area. Non farmers attribute this to lack of hedges. The isolated nature of life in the fen means that people here are generally less concerned with the usual problems of urban living.
